hotspots.label: Central Cavity
hotspots.fact: This hollow space inside the squash holds all the seeds! The cavity protects the seeds and stores nutrients that help them grow into new plants.

hotspots.label: Seeds and Fibers
hotspots.fact: The stringy fibers you see are called vascular tissue, which carries water and nutrients throughout the fruit. The seeds are surrounded by these fibers for protection and nutrition.

hotspots.label: Flesh (Pulp)
hotspots.fact: This thick, yellowish part is full of starches and sugars that taste sweet and creamy when cooked. It's packed with vitamins that help keep us healthy!

hotspots.label: Green Skin
hotspots.fact: The hard outer skin protects the fruit inside from damage and pests. It's made of waxy cells that keep moisture from escaping and help the fruit stay fresh.
